_header: In Syria whilom dwelt a company
Title(s): Man of Law’s Tale; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Man of Law’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 1026 lines in rhyme royal stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
In Surre vmwhile dwelled a companyeof chapmen riche & therto
                    sadde & trewe…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…ioye after wo gouerne vs in his graceand kepe vs alle that
                    ben in this place
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
the man of lawe (RT); Here endith the man of lawe his tale… (f.
                    157)

                    þerto sad & trewe…
BodBar20.Last Lines:

                    ben in þis place
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
The Man of law (RT); here endith þe tale of þe man of law…
                    (f. 78v)

                    ben in this place

CULEe215.First Lines:
In surrey wylom dvelled a companyOf chapmen ryche & ther to sad
                    & trewe…
CULEe215.Last Lines:
…Ioye of thys worlde for tyme wolle nat a bydeffro day to
                    nyght hit chavngethe as the tyde

BLAdd25718.First Lines:
In Surrye whilom dwelled acompAnyeOf Chapmen riche and therto sadde
                    & trewe…
BLAdd25718.Last Lines:
…When þat þe kyng þis cursed letre sentAnd
                    Custance with a dedly and pale face…

BLAdd35286.First Lines:
…For thei han seyn hir euer so vertuousAnd louyng hermengold

BLAdd35286.Last Lines:
…Ioy aftyr wo gouerne vs in his graceAnd kepe vs al that ben
                    in this place

BLHar5908.First Lines:
…Takeþ it aȝen I ȝeue ȝew leue of my
                    graceReturneþ to ȝoure faderes house quod he…
BLHar5908.Last Lines:
…The smok quod he þat þou haste oppon þi bakLet
                    it be stil and bere it forþe wiþ þe…
BLHar5908.Note:
Chaucer’s Clerk’s Tale, lines IV.808-91 of The
                        Canterbury Tales.

BLHar7333.First Lines:

BLHar7333.Last Lines:

                    þat ben in this place Amen
BLHar7333.Note:
II.671 omitted; 324, 485, 796 inserted in margin; 377-8
                    reversed.
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
…the begynnyng / of the tale (f. 60); Here endithe the Man of Lawes
                    tale (f. 65).

Chats.First Lines:
…Now ladie bright to whom all wofull crienÞou glorie of
                    womanhed þu faire may…
Chats.Last Lines:

                    of hys kyndnes…
Chats.Note:
Two fragments of the Man of Law’s Tale: II.850-924;
                    1076-1144.

In Surrie whilom dwelled a companyeOf chapmen riche and therto

PhilRos10841.First Lines:
In surrye whylom dwelled a companyeOf chapmen ryche and therto sad
                    and trewe…
PhilRos10841.Last Lines:
…Ioy after woo gouerne vs in hys graceAnd kepe vs alle that
                    ben in thys place
PhilRos10841.Note:
II.381-2 omitted. The MS is misbound, with [13].8 following [12].7
                    (becoming f. 43) and Q [14] misbound to follow Q [12] (with [14] foliated 44-51,
                    and [13] foliated 52-57). Quires [1-4] and [6-7] are inferred to be lost, with
                    the foliation not taking account of them. Thus V.9-91 follow II.558-1190 and are
                    in turn followed by II.79-557; a blank leaf follows, and then V.92, etc.
                    V.656-72 lost; 134-40 omitted.
PhilRos10841.Attributed Title:
The Man of lawe (RT); Here endeth the tale of the man of lawe (f.
                        50v, rubric)

PhilRos10842.First Lines: In Surry whylom dwelled a company…
PhilRos10842.Last Lines: …A thowsand fold more þan I can tel…
PhilRos10842.Note:
Contains fragments of the Man of Law’s Tale on three
                    folios: II.95-140, 211-350, 1051-1120.

In surrey som tyme ther dwellid a companyof chapman
                    riche and þerto sadde & trewe…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…Ioy aftir wo gouerne vs in his graceand kepe vs alle þat
                    been in this place
BNangl39.Note:
II.176-82, 528-9 omitted; 678-9 reversed; spurious lines follow 521,
                    522, 527, 531.
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
…& incipit fabula (f. 25rb); Explicit fabula
                        seruientis ad / legem sine iurisperiti… (f.
                    31rb)
